Artists & Artisans

This is an area filled with creative people who are inspired by the beauty of their surroundings. Refresh your senses by exploring the many studios, shops and galleries in and around Kaslo. With diverse artwork from pottery to painting, sculpture to the textile arts, you will surely bring some inspiration home with you.

You might also like:

The Live Art Shop

All local Art!

With artists…

  • Eliza Fry, Mixed Media Artist 
  • Manon Gagnon, Potter
  • Jane Gao, Painter
  • Liz Honey, Watercolorist
  • Barbara Kingsland, Basket Maker
  • Sarah Lawless, Potter
  • Emily Mattas, Knitter
  • Sara Rainford, Photographer
  • Geri Rinkel, Potter
  • Collen Stimpson, Oil Painter
  • Birgit Stradal, Ceramist

Sarah Lawless Pottery

Sarah creates a line of porcelain ceramics, combining ergonomic usability with a sculptural emphasis on form. Her pots are thrown on a wheel and altered into imaginative ﬂuid forms with soft

Read More

Eliza Fry

 “From an early age I have always loved to draw, paint, cut, glue and assemble,” says Eliza. While growing up Eliza was sure she would become either an artist or an architect. Mixed media combines all the different techniques Eliza has tried and has become her favourite medium. 

Creating art is Eliza’s meditation, spirituality and means of communicating with the rest of humanity. Through her art she also makes statements about personal and social issues.

Read More

Suzanne McLean

Expressionist and abstract paintings. 

Resident artist at the Bluebelle Bistro & Beanery.

Suzanne McLean is a landscape painter working primarily in acrylics. Her painting style ranges from modern impressionism to expressionistic abstraction. She is known for her bold use of colour, expressive brushwork and her use of palette knives. Her work can be viewed year round at the BlueBelle Bistro & Beanery, Front Street and 4th, in downtown Kaslo.

Read More

Robin Wiltse Feltworks

 Robin Wiltse works out of her Kaslo studio on the top floor of the Langham Cultural Centre where she has a stunning view of Kootenay Lake. Originally from the hamlet of Black Creek on Vancouver Island, Robin moved inland to study fibre arts at Nelson’s Kootenay School of the Arts. In Nelson she discovered a new medium and a new love, felting.

Read More

Rick Taylor Bronze Sculptor

 Rick is one of the most renowned wildlife artists on the contemporary sculpture scene. His art is appreciated and collected by museums and individuals from all over the world. His focus is centered on wild sheep but his artwork covers species and subjects from all corners of the globe.

Read More

Rielle Oswald

At the Langham Gallery July 22 - Aug 15.

Rielle Oswald currently teaches Art, Music and other fun subjects to grades K through 12 at the local school in Kaslo. 

Read More

Linda Cole

At the Last Stitch Quilt Shoppe’s working studio, stitch artist Linda Cole continues to explore the medium of fabric arts, through traditional quilting design, stitching projects and portraits in fabric collage. You’ll find works in progress, finished quilts to take home, quilting supplies, books and kits when you visit The Last Stitch Quilt Shoppe at 343 Front Street.

 

Read More

Laserdit

 Laserdit of Meadow Creek, BC specializes in creating spectacular architectural and artistic elements for both corporate and residential settings. 

By practicing the art of combining age old techniques with space age tools they can take your photo and realistically engrave stone, wood, plastics and metals, to wood inlays of incredible complexity and perfection. Laserdit can make your vision a reality!

Read More

Hotcakes Ceramics

Bright & happy ceramics hand made in Kaslo BC Canada. Whimsical tableware, vases and tiles.

 

Hotcakes Ceramics is owned and operated by Birgit Stradal. The tableware she creates is bright, happy and colourful. Birgit was taught the fine craft of creating tableware in Amsterdam, where she attended courses for over three years. In the Kootenays Birgit sells her work through local stores, at markets and from her studio in Mirror Lake. 

Read More
